intro: Evota affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved evota, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the tips of the branches. Evota affinis is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories.
